qas.question: What is a parliamentary model on which other systems have been based?
What kind of role is the head of state in Westminster-based parliamentary governments?
In wich parlimentry system is the monarch the head of state?
In what system does the prime minister have reserve powers?

context: In parliamentary systems fashioned after the <a0_0><b2_0><b3_0>Westminster system<b3_0/><b2_0/><a0_0/>, the prime minister is the presiding and actual head of government and head of the executive branch. In such systems, the head of state or the head of state's official representative (i.e. the monarch, president, or governor-general) usually holds a largely <a1_0>ceremonial<a1_0/> position, although often with reserve powers.
